sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"选择"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: choose, select, elect, pick, prefer, opt
means: choose ： 普通用词，侧重根据个人意愿和判断从众多的对象中进行选择，着重被选者的优点。
select ： 书面用词，具有庄严、正式的感情色彩。强调精选。
elect ： 指按照一定的规章或法律，用投票等方式进行的认真慎重的选择。
pick ： 口语用词，多指从个人角度仔细挑选，也含任意挑选之意。
prefer ： 强调个人偏爱，不一定有选择的行动。
opt ： 多指在几种可能性之间进行选择。

sentence.Network_en: For added protection choose a lipstick with a sun screen.
sentence.Network_cn: 选择防晒护唇膏来增强保护。

sentence.Network_en: Choose a soft, medium or firm mattress to suit their individual needs.
sentence.Network_cn: 针对他们各人不同的需要挑选柔软、软硬适中或者坚硬的床垫。

sentence.Network_en: Knox had taken it on himself to choose the wine.
sentence.Network_cn: 诺克斯擅自作主，选了葡萄酒。

jx.jx_en_mean: To choose players and form sides or teams for a game, such as baseball or softball.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 选球员组队：在棒球或软式棒球等运动中挑选队员组成两方或两队

phrase.cizu_name: there is little (或 nothing) to choose between

jx.jx_en_mean: there is little or no difference between

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cēosan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kiezen

entry.def: If you choose someone or something from several people or things that are available, you decide which person or thing you want to have.

example.ex: They will be able to choose their own leaders in democratic elections...
example.tran: 他们将能够通过民主选举选择自己的领导人。

example.ex: This week he has chosen Peter Mandelson to replace Mo Mowlam...
example.tran: 本周他选择了彼得·曼德尔森来代替莫·摩兰姆。

entry.def: If you choose to do something, you do it because you want to or because you feel that it is right.

example.ex: They knew that discrimination was going on, but chose to ignore it...
example.tran: 他们当时知道歧视现象仍然存在，但是宁愿装聋作哑。

example.ex: You can just take out the interest each year, if you choose.
example.tran: 你要是愿意，每年可以仅支取利息。

entry.def: If there is little to choose between people or things or nothing to choose between them, it is difficult to decide which is better or more suitable.

example.ex: There is very little to choose between the world's top tennis players.
example.tran: 世界顶级网球运动员之间往往难分伯仲。

entry.tran: 享受优厚待遇的少数人；精英
entry.def: The chosen few are a small group who are treated better than other people. You sometimes use this expression when you think this is unfair.

example.ex: Learning should no longer be an elitist pastime for the chosen few.
example.tran: 学习不应再是少数人的高级消遣。

means.word_mean: 1. pick out, select, or choose from a number of alternatives;

sentences.sentence: "Choose a good husband for your daughter"
"She selected a pair of shoes from among the dozen the salesgirl had shown her"

means.word_mean: 2. select as an alternative; choose instead; prefer as an alternative;

sentences.sentence: "I always choose the fish over the meat courses in this restaurant"
"She opted for the job on the East coast"

means.word_mean: 3. see fit or proper to act in a certain way; decide to act in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "She chose not to attend classes and now she failed the exam"

Sentence.sentence: American women who choose to be employed are far more likely to work full-time and to hold high-level jobs as manangers or professionals.
Swedish women are allowed the freedom and opportunity to choose their own way of life
At each college, the students who choose to get an iPhone must pay for mobile phone service.

sentences.cn: 我别无选择, 只好等待。

sentences.en: I've chosen them because of the colours.
sentences.cn: 我因颜色好而挑选了它们。

sentences.en: We choose her a nice birthday present.
sentences.cn: 我们给她挑选了一件精致的生日礼物。

sentences.en: We choose an expensive toy for the boy.
sentences.cn: 我们给孩子买了一件昂贵的玩具。

sentences.en: They choose me to be their representative.
sentences.cn: 他们选我作他们的代表。

sentences.en: He chose not to go home until later.
Have you chosen what you want for your birthday?
sentences.cn: 你过生日要什么东西决定了吗?

sentences.en: She chose happiness instead of wealth.
sentences.cn: 她宁愿要幸福而舍弃财富。

jushi.chinese: 你愿意怎么办就怎么办。
